svg.text: This example illustrates modeling transmit antenna gain. The Sender has an 8-element beamforming antenna with a steering angle applied. When you run this model, the Receiver will move around the Sender and measure the received power. It then plots the receive power on a polar plot, with the distance from the origin representing the received power, and the angle representing the angle of its position relative to the transmitter. In effect, it measures and displays the antenna gain pattern of the Sender.
Author: Yang Zhao, Rachel Zhou, and Edward A. Lee
Receive the signal, extract its received power, and display the received power on a polar plot where the angle is the angle of the position of this actor relative to the position of the Sender.

property.name: text
property.value: Reverse Y direction (the plotter has Y increasing upwards, and Vergil has Y increasing downwards).

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: Ramp2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

property.name: text
property.value: The TransmitPropertyTransformer actor delegates to another Ptolemy II model to calculate the transmit properties.

property.name: text
property.value: Given an angle, produce the gain of a linear array of evenly spaced antenna elements.

property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Rachel Zhou and Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value: Angle of arrival of a plane wave.

property.name: text
property.value: Input signal is a phasor representation of a sinusoidal waveform.

property.name: text
property.value: Model the stimulus measured by each antenna element.

property.name: text
property.value: These two actors apply a contained model to each element of the input arrays. They are examples of higher- order components.

entity.name: AntennaElements
entity.doc: Iterate a contained actor over input arrays

property.name: text
property.value: Compute the phase change for a particular antenna element as a complex phasor. This phase change is a function of the position of the antenna element. In this model, we assume that the X positions of all the elements are the same, and that the Y positions are given by the elementPositionY parameter.

property.name: text
property.value: The iterationCount parameter is set automatically by the IterateOverArray actor. It will range from 1 to 8, for example, if the input array has 8 elements.

property.name: text
property.value: Adjust the phase of the input (complex exponential) signal received at a particular antenna element.

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: Steering
entity.doc: Iterate a contained actor over input arrays
